content: What is the name of the 19th-century American author known for his tales of mystery and macabre, also a common bird in the crow family?

You're referring to Edgar Allan Poe, the famous 19th-century American author known for his dark and macabre works. Poe is indeed associated with the Raven, which is a common bird in the crow family. His renowned poem "The Raven" features a talking raven that symbolizes death and loss. So, Edgar Allan Poe is both the author you're thinking of and has a connection to the raven bird.
